Class DutiesCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • DutiesCalculator

  • public class DutiesCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all the methods to calculate the duties that an industry should pay in a quarter after the waste water discharges samples have been validated by the government. If the quality of the waste water sample is "satisfactory", then the industry is exempted of paying duties. If the compliance result is "unsatisfactory" then the industry should pay duties. The amount of duties is calculated based on the cubic meters of waste water discharged and the rate of duties by cubic meter that is determined as a result of the industry type classification and the body of water classification.
    Author:
    danteruiz

      Calculates the total amount of duties that the industry should pay based on the rate in dollars per cubic meters, volume of waste water discharged in cubic meters, and the compliance result of the corresponding validated analysis.

    • Method Detail

      • getTotalWasteWaterDuties

        public double getTotalWasteWaterDuties(double rate,
                                       double volume,
                                       java.lang.String complianceResults)
        Calculates the total amount of duties that the industry should pay based on the rate in dollars per cubic meters, volume of waste water discharged in cubic meters, and the compliance result of the corresponding validated analysis. If the compliance result is satisfactory, the total amount is zero dollars. However, if the compliance result is unsatisfactory the total amount is calculated as rate times volume.
        Parameters:
        rate -
        volume -
        complianceResults -
        Returns:

        public double getDutiesRate(int industryClassificationIndex,
                            int bodyOfWaterIndex)
        Chooses the correct rate of duties in cubic meters from a matrix of rates by industry classification and receiving bodies of water.

      • getIndustryClassification

        public int getIndustryClassification()
        Asks the user to enter the correct industry classification. It searches the position of the name of the industry from an array of strings. Returns the position of the name of industry from the array. If the name is not found, it returns -1.

      • getBodyOfWaterClassification

        public int getBodyOfWaterClassification()
        Asks the user to enter the correct body of water. It searches the position of the name of the body of water from an array of strings. Returns the position of the name of body of water from the array. If the name is not found, it returns -1.
